QR Code Link to This Post
Ask for a free application via email. If you are financially eligible for the unit, you will be able to set up a viewing.
Multiple bedrooms at Baker's Dozen housing cooperative. Baker's Dozen is a consensus-based, non-hierarchical housing cooperative that strives to build a sustainable and permanently affordable intentional community. We model how accountability, trust, and mutual appreciation work. We want to live these values in a real world where anti-gentrification, anti-oppression, and queer spaces are fought for and celebrated.
Note: Units are individual bedrooms. Kitchen, bathrooms, and living rooms are shared amongst residents.
Income Requirement: Income must be between $28,260 and $54,450.
Utilities: Residents pay water, gas, electric, sewer
Limited Accessibility in building

QR Code Link to This Post
This is a cozy in-law room located in the ground level of the house. The room is carpeted and comes with a desk, chair and wardrobe.
You will get your private room and share the kitchenette and bathroom with another housemate downstairs.
Very quiet and relaxing, suitable for students or working professionals.
The house is located within a block to MUNI M line, and bus #29 with easy access to both SFSU and CCSF in less than 10 minutes. Close to all amenities, restaurants, and grocery stores.
- High speed fiber optic Wi-Fi available.
- Low shared utilities
- FREE on site laundry (washer and dryer in the garage).
- First and last month's rent plus $750 refundable security deposit to move in.
*** No drugs, No pets, No parties, No sleepovers***
** Single Occupancy.
+++Minimum 6 months or one year lease required.+++
## Available NOW.
You may respond to the ad with some info about yourself, your job or any other source of income, and your phone number to be contacted.

‚ÄúLocated on the north end of San Francisco and encompassing Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf, Telegraph Hill, and Embarcadero, North Beach is a large neighborhood on the bay with diverse neighborhoods and plenty to do. Some of San Francisco‚Äôs most iconic landmarks are located here, including Pioneer Park, Coit Tower, Pier 39, and Washington Square. Considered one of the nation‚Äôs best neighborhoods, North Beach started out as an actual beach and was filled in during the late 1800s.
During the 1950s, North Beach was a meeting place for the Beat Generation, a literary movement that included several famous authors like Jack Kerouac and Allen Ginsberg. Learn more about this important movement at the Beat Museum, located off Broadway. North Beach is hilly, and several famous staircases are located throughout. Climb to the top of the Peter Macciarini Steps for terrific views of the Financial District, the Vallejo Stairs for beautiful bay views, or the garden-filled Filbert Street Stairs.
Like all of San Francisco, you won‚Äôt be lacking great restaurants or nightlife when you move to North Beach. Some neighborhood favorites include Tony‚Äôs Pizza Napoletana, Caffe Trieste, Sotto Mare, Mama‚Äôs on Washington Square, and Hillstone.‚Äù
-Apartments.com

‚ÄúFamous for being the largest Chinatown outside of Asia, San Francisco‚Äôs Chinatown is a vibrant neighborhood teeming with cultural offerings. Nestled between Nob Hill and the Financial District, Chinatown is one of the top destinations in the city for its fantastic sights, shopping, and dining.
Grant Avenue and Stockton Street are the neighborhood‚Äôs main thoroughfares, each touting rows of dim sum spots, bakeries, tea houses, cafes, markets, and specialty stores. Some of Chinatown‚Äôs most notable landmarks include the Dragon‚Äôs Gate, the Chinese Historical Society of America, and Tin How Temple.
Chinatown residents enjoy an array of lively, year-round events, such as the Chinese Culture Center Spring Festival, Autumn Moon Festival, and the popular Chinese New Year Festival and Parade. The neighborhood‚Äôs central locale affords residents easy commutes and travels.‚Äù

Unit #134 is an interior-facing private room located in an SRO (Single room occupancy) building with a countertop, under-sink storage, and a closet. The units are private, and the kitchen and bathrooms are communal.
Structure Properties is pleased to present the newly-renovated Jackson Square Commons located at 706 Kearny Street! Modern decor paired with a prime Financial District location makes this a truly one-of-a-kind community. The new renovation features high ceilings, modern engineered flooring, vanity with granite countertop and closet storage. The building boasts a beautifully designed resident lounge that has been meticulously decorated for coziness and comfort, offering the perfect place to enjoy the company of your neighbors and friends. The shared, single-stall restrooms and showers feature bright tile and ultimate privacy. The kitchen provides new cooktops, stainless microwaves and toaster ovens and a deep sink with drying area. We are pleased to offer custom-designed furniture packages for a small monthly fee, making your move stress and hassle free!
Jackson Square Commons is located within walking distance to Chinatown, BART, The Ferry Building and multiple major Muni lines. Also within walking distance you'll find multiple grocery options, vibrant shopping and arguably the City's best farmers market open on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays.
Lease Terms:
One-year lease with no utilities included. This is a non-smoking community. No pets allowed.

The shared bathrooms are lined with subway tile, and feature new private shower stalls, stone countertops and modern finishes. The two community kitchens, also brand new, feature industrial cooktops, stainless steel countertops and a small dining area.

Take a breather from all of the action by strolling the waterfront or picking up fresh produce at the Ferry Building's weekly farmer's market! Decades of culture as well as amazing food and ambiance are just steps away from your front door. The proximity to Market St offers plenty of public transit options via Muni Metro, BART and Golden Gate Transit.

QR Code Link to This Post
Hello!
The Room:
On offer is a beautiful, large room in a prime location within the mission. The room is roughly 10' wide and 9' long. The room currently accommodates two dressers, a desk, a California king bed, a chair, a jewelry armoire, and a nightstand. The room has a closet in the room and one across the hallway with some additional storage space as well. The bay windows face south and receive some direct sun throughout the day. The house has hardwood floors and gets lots of light throughout. The dining room and living room are open and spacious.
House Layout:
The house is the top two stories of a duplex. This room is located on the first floor, where the kitchen, dining space, and living room are all located. There are two other rooms on this floor and a total of two bathrooms on this level. Upstairs there are three more rooms and three more roommates, who all share one bathroom, although we are all free to use whichever bathroom is closest to us when the need arises.
The house contains a total of six roommates (including this room). The kitchen is large and we never have issues sharing space as everyone has their own schedule. There are two large fridges that are each shared three ways and you will have your own dedicated shelf in the fridge. There is dedicated space in the pantry as well for each roommate.
Amenities:
The apartment has in unit washer and dryer. The landlord is very responsive when called upon and I haven't had a better landlord in the 10+ years I've lived in SF. The apartment has a back patio / backyard space that is shared with the downstairs neighbors. The downstairs neighbors are incredibly warm. They have two young children and are always friendly with conversation and communication. There is a cleaner that comes twice a month to clean common spaces. There is a garage with a space you might be able to rent for an additional cost. That will need to be worked out with the landlord.
The Vibe:
The roommates are all open to new folks bringing their own furniture, decorations for common space, and ideas for changing things up. The vibe with the roommates is very laid back and we all care about each other, pitching in to help each other out when necessary and respecting each other. We enjoy laughing together and talking about life openly. We are all very busy and have our own social lives but still enjoy the occasional impromptu dinner or activity together. Anyone would be lucky to live with this awesome group of individuals. This would be a good fit for anyone that wants a house with built-in warmth. We are all busy and keep our own schedule but moments when we overlap at home are filled with conversation and joy.
Utilities:
Average around $100/month per person.
Move in:
I am flexible on move in dates. I can be gone at any date and can work to accommodate your schedule. If you're interested you'll need to fill out this questionnaire. If the link isn't working, just reply to this ad and we'll send it over so you can tell us about yourself. From there, we will schedule a meet & greet with the roommates so you can feel each other out :). Can't wait to meet you!
Questionnaire Link:
https://forms.gle/Ty75e5ys6qUGj31L7
The Roommates:
B: 28, college admission counsellor for UC Berkeley. He rcently moved here from Durham, North Carolina (4 months ago) and enjoys running and exploring the city.
D: 35, works in tech sales. Enjoys skiing and travels a lot for work. Her favorite band is Phish.
W: 30, works in events for a tech company. Teaches yoga in her spare time and loves crafts and all dogs.
M: 31, works in tech sales. Enjoys riding her bike and building community. Moved here from New York. Laughs a lot so you can feel funny even if you're not.
R: 30, on sabbatical, worked in renewable development, and currently traveling the world for the next 2 months. Burner, free spirit, health-conscious, and likes to cook.

Start your morning with coffee at Blue Bottle Coffee or Cafe de la Presse, both just steps away. For a quick lunch, grab a bite at The Grove or sample international flavors like Sai Jai Thai or Ararat Kebab & Gyros. Piccolo Italia is just a block away for a late night dining experience. Fast food standbys KFC and Round Table Pizza are nearby as well.

Stroll over to Union Square, a 16 minute walk from your door, for world-class shopping including top named designers like Chanel, Ralph Lauren and Hermes or get in touch with your inner child at the 2nd US location, and newly opened Nintendo Store. Polk Street is another nearby destination for vintage boutiques like ReLove San Francisco and other fun shops like Polk Market & Gift Shop and Picnic.
When you‚Äôre ready for some fresh air, a weekend stroll or a walk with your pup, since we‚Äôre proud to be a pet-friendly community, nearby parks include Jefferson Square Park with walking paths, benches and grass areas for picnics & an off leash dog play area for you pet lovers. Lafayette Park has a playground for the kids, lush grass and a dog park play area, complete with shaded seating areas for the humans, modern LED lighting for evenings and ground level water fountains for the doggos. Literally less than a stone's throw away from an N-Judah Metro stop and two blocks away from Golden Gate Park, this bottom level In-Law has been freshly painted and is in move-in condition. It has recently refinished and resealed bamboo flooring throughout except in the bathroom. Upgraded kitchen appliances include air fryer oven and new microwave, granite countertops with under-mounted stainless sink. No dishwasher. A new key-optional electronic door lock with separate deadbolt in entry. Bathroom with updated plumbing fixtures boasts a walk-in shower stall. Electric heating in the kitchen area complimented with new supplemental electric heater in the bedroom. Access to an exclusive portion of the backyard via patio doors with insect netting. Includes sole use of a 5‚Äôx7‚Äô locked storage area.
Tenant pays for garbage and electricity (individual meter) while water is included. There is no current laundry on site, so for those unclear: no washer / no dryer, but a laundry service is a block away. Easy street parking follows street cleaning regulations with no need for permits.
* No smoking/vaping of tobacco, pot, or drugs otherwise
* No dogs or strange critters, including no fishtanks due to bamboo flooring. A cat may be considered on a case by case basis with refundable pet deposit.
Lease term is one year. Security deposit (one month's rent) of $1,800 and $1,800 rent due when moving in. Please bring current credit report with score, income verification with recent pay stubs and valid photo ID when viewing unit. QR Code Link to This Post
Remodeled Victoria mini-loft in the Emeric-Goodman Building, an official
City landmark. Studios with sleeping lofts. Geary @ Van Ness.
College students with parent co-signers ok.
Available mid-November.
Listed on the National Register of Historic Places. National Register #75000473.
San Francisco Landmark #71: This building was constructed by Joseph Emeric from France as his residence. It remained in his family until 1899 when his granddaughter sold it to Abraham and Sarah Goodman from New York. The Goodmans ran a tailoring business on the ground floor and lived above the store. After surviving the Great Earthquake and Fire, the building was extensively repaired and modernized. The building was completely renovated again between 1983-1985 preserving all the historical details, including the Victorian fa√ßade and birdcage elevator....
The renovation received a citation for architectural conservation from Foundation for San Francisco's Architectural Heritage . Janis Joplin had lived in a small room on the second floor in the early sixties, as had Wes Wilson, who created the first Psychedelic posters for the musical events at the Avalon-Family Dog and Fillmore-Bill Graham....
Hi-tech intercom with video....
New hardwood floors, stainless steel appliances, granite counters. Birdcage elevator. Large windows. Laundry in building. Roof deck.
Non-smoking building....
Close to Civic Center, Japantown, Van Ness movie theaters, major churches
and best bus (Geary/O'Farrell 38). Garage parking available nearby @ about $300/mo.

QR Code Link to This Post
Remodeled Victorian Mini-Lofts in the Emeric-Goodman Building, an official
City landmark. Studios with sleeping lofts. Geary @ Van Ness.
Now with hi-tech intercom and video camera.
Studio with separate sleeping loft. From $1850 (single occupant rate).
One BR. $2100. (single or double occupant rate).
College students with parent co-signers ok.
Listed on the National Register of Historic Places . National Register #75000473
San Francisco Landmark #71: This building was constructed by Joseph Emeric from France as his residence. It remained in his family until 1899 when his granddaughter sold it to Abraham and Sarah Goodman from New York. The Goodmans ran a tailoring business on the ground floor and lived above the store. After surviving the Great Earthquake and Fire, the building was extensively repaired and modernized. The building was completely renovated again between 1983-1985 preserving all the historical details, including the Victorian fa√ßade and birdcage elevator.
The renovation received a citation for architectural conservation from Foundation for San Francisco's Architectural Heritage . Janis Joplin had lived in a small room on the second floor in the early sixties, as had Wes Wilson, who created the first Psychedelic posters for the Family Dog and Bill Graham.
New hardwood floors, stainless steel appliances, granite counters, spiral
staircase to sleeping loft with floor to ceiling bookcases and closets on
2 levels. The sleeping loft is the bedroom and is not high enough to stand
for most people. Birdcage elevator. Large windows. Laundry in building. Bicycle room. Roof deck.
Non-smoking building.
Close to Civic Center, Van Ness movie theaters, major churches
and best bus (Geary/O'Farrell 38). Garage parking available nearby

QR Code Link to This Post
Remodeled Victorian Mini-Lofts in the Emeric-Goodman Building, an official
City landmark. Studios with sleeping lofts. Geary @ Van Ness. Laundry; roof deck; birdcage elevator....
Now with hi-tech intercom with video.....
Studio with separate sleeping loft. = 1BR. $1850 (single occupant rate).
College students with parent co-signers ok. ....
..
Several unique units available with lofts and/or with separate bedrooms.
Individual  self-contained heaters ...................
Listed on the National Register of Historic Places . National Register #75000473
San Francisco Landmark #71: This building was constructed by Joseph Emeric from France as his residence. It remained in his family until 1899 when his granddaughter sold it to Abraham and Sarah Goodman from New York. The Goodmans ran a tailoring business on the ground floor and lived above the store. After surviving the Great Earthquake and Fire, the building was extensively repaired and modernized. The building was completely renovated again between 1983-1985 preserving all the historical details, including the Victorian fa√ßade and birdcage elevator. ........
The renovation received a citation for architectural conservation from Foundation for San Francisco's Architectural Heritage . Janis Joplin had lived in a small room on the second floor in the early sixties, as had Wes Wilson, who created the first Psychedelic posters for the Family Dog and Bill Graham..............
Hardwood floors, stainless steel appliances, granite counters, spiral
staircase to sleeping loft with floor to ceiling bookcases and closets on
2 levels. The sleeping loft is the bedroom and is not high enough to stand
for most people. Birdcage elevator. Large windows. Laundry in building. Bicycle room. Roof deck.
Non-smoking building.....
Close to Civic Center, Japantown, Van Ness movie theaters, major churches
and best bus (Geary/O'Farrell 38). Garage parking available nearby @ about $300/mo.

QR Code Link to This Post
Remodeled Victorian Mini-Lofts in the Emeric-Goodman Building, an official
City landmark. Studios with sleeping lofts. Geary @ Van Ness.
Now with hi-tech intercom and video camera.
Studio with separate sleeping loft. From $1850 (single occupant rate).
One BR. $2100. (single or double occupant rate).
College students with parent co-signers ok.
Listed on the National Register of Historic Places . National Register #75000473
San Francisco Landmark #71: This building was constructed by Joseph Emeric from France as his residence. It remained in his family until 1899 when his granddaughter sold it to Abraham and Sarah Goodman from New York. The Goodmans ran a tailoring business on the ground floor and lived above the store. After surviving the Great Earthquake and Fire, the building was extensively repaired and modernized. The building was completely renovated again between 1983-1985 preserving all the historical details, including the Victorian fa√ßade and birdcage elevator.
The renovation received a citation for architectural conservation from Foundation for San Francisco's Architectural Heritage . Janis Joplin had lived in a small room on the second floor in the early sixties, as had Wes Wilson, who created the first Psychedelic posters for the Family Dog and Bill Graham.
New hardwood floors, stainless steel appliances, granite counters, spiral
staircase to sleeping loft with floor to ceiling bookcases and closets on
2 levels. The sleeping loft is the bedroom and is not high enough to stand
for most people. Birdcage elevator. Large windows. Laundry in building. Bicycle room. Roof deck.
Non-smoking building.
Close to Civic Center, Van Ness movie theaters, major churches
and best bus (Geary/O'Farrell 38). Garage parking available nearby

Residents of Lower Nob Hill enjoy a lively atmosphere with plenty of entertainment options just steps from their front door. Whether you're looking for a quick bite to eat, a night out with friends, or a relaxing afternoon at the park, Lower Nob Hill has something for everyone.
Overall, Lower Nob Hill offers a unique blend of urban living and community charm, making it an ideal place to call home in one of the most exciting cities in the world.

QR Code Link to This Post
Remodeled Victorian One bedrooms some with mini-lofts in the Emeric-Goodman Building, an official
City landmark. Studios with sleeping lofts. Geary @ Van Ness.
Separate bedroom + living room.  $2100. (single or double occupant rate).
Studio with sleeping loft. = 1BR. $1850 (single occupant rate).
College students with parent co-signers ok.
Listed on the National Register of Historic Places. National Register #75000473
San Francisco Landmark #71: This building was constructed by Joseph Emeric from France as his residence. It remained in his family until 1899 when his granddaughter sold it to Abraham and Sarah Goodman from New York. The Goodmans ran a tailoring business on the ground floor and lived above the store. After surviving the Great Earthquake and Fire, the building was extensively repaired and modernized. The building was completely renovated again between 1983-1985 preserving all the historical details, including the Victorian fa√ßade and birdcage elevator.
The renovation received a citation for architectural conservation from Foundation for San Francisco's Architectural Heritage . Janis Joplin had lived in a small room on the second floor in the early sixties, as had Wes Wilson, who created the first Psychedelic posters for the musical events at the Avalon-Family Dog and Fillmore-Bill Graham.
Hi-tech intercom with video.
New hardwood floors, stainless steel appliances, granite counters, spiral
staircase to sleeping loft with floor to ceiling bookcases and closets on
2 levels. The sleeping loft is the bedroom and is not high enough to stand
for most people. Birdcage elevator. Large windows. Laundry in building. Roof deck.
Non-smoking building.
Close to Civic Center, Japantown, Van Ness movie theaters, major churches
and best bus (Geary/O'Farrell 38). Garage parking available nearby

Remodeled Victorian Mini-Lofts in the Emeric-Goodman Building, an official
City landmark.Geary @ Van Ness.
High-tech intercom with video.  Across the street from the new CPMC hospital.
Garage parking in area for $300.
One bedroom and living room. $2100.00

Listed on the National Register of Historic Places. National Register #75000473
San Francisco Landmark #71: This building was constructed by Joseph Emeric from France as his residence. It remained in his family until 1899 when his granddaughter sold it to Abraham and Sarah Goodman from New York. The Goodmans ran a tailoring business on the ground floor and lived above the store. After surviving the Great Earthquake and Fire, the building was extensively repaired and modernized. The building was completely renovated again between 1983-1985 preserving all the historical details, including the Victorian fa√ßade and birdcage elevator.
The renovation received a citation for architectural conservation from Foundation for San Francisco's Architectural Heritage . Janis Joplin  lived in the building in the  early sixties, as did Wes Wilson, who created the first Psychedelic posters for the musical events at the Avalon-Family Dog and Fillmore-Bill Graham venues.
New hardwood floors, stainless steel appliances, granite counters, spiral
staircase to sleeping loft with floor to ceiling bookcases and closets on
2 levels. The sleeping loft is the bedroom and is not high enough to stand
for most people. Birdcage elevator. Large windows. Laundry in building. Bicycle room. Roof deck.
Non-smoking building.
Close to Civic Center, Japantown, Van Ness movie theaters, major churches
and best bus (Geary/O'Farrell 38). Garage parking available nearby at about $300/mo.

Start your morning with coffee at Caf√© Trieste or Red Bay Coffee, both just steps away. For a quick lunch, enjoy Bouchon Bakery, Souvla for Greek fare, or explore a variety of international flavors at nearby eateries like Plow and Little Star Pizza.

When you‚Äôre ready for some fresh air, nearby parks include Huntington Park, Alta Plaza Park, and Lafayette Park, each offering green escapes within walking distance. A short ride takes you to the Tunnel Tops at The Presidio, where sweeping views of the Golden Gate Bridge and the Bay await. Perfect for a weekend stroll or a walk with your pup, since we‚Äôre proud to be a pet-friendly community!

Quite four unit building with lots of windows for sunshine and warmth in the Mission District. Near Muni and Highways 280 and 101. Laundry is two blocks away on 24th Street or York. Large yard available to use. Hardwood floors and tile throughout the unit. Has two separate rooms with a large eat-in kitchen with built-in cabinets, large refrigerator, and four burner gas stove. Separate bedroom with large closet and bathroom with a tub/shower. This is a quite space on the first floor (garage underneath unit). Can park bikes in the  yard in the bike racks. Street parking is available and the tenant can get a permit from the City for all day parking. Unit is clean and ready to be rented.
Water and garbage paid by owner, the tenant is responsible for PG&E. A security of $2,450 is required. No pets or smoking in the building.  The unit has porch that leads to a big yard next to Ralph park.

This bright and charming one-bedroom apartment in the heart of Nob Hill offers classic San Francisco character with thoughtful modern updates. Freshly painted and filled with natural light from large east- and west-facing windows, the unit features hardwood floors, 9-foot ceilings, detailed molding, and spacious rooms, including a generous living room and bedroom with excellent closet space. The eat-in kitchen includes brand-new stainless-steel appliances, such as a gas range and microwave range hood, and a large window that brightens the space. The all-tile bathroom features a tub-shower combination, a new sink with a Grohe faucet, and a Toto toilet.
Located in a well-maintained, family-owned building, the apartment offers access to a welcoming lobby, a modernized elevator, and an upgraded steam-heating system. All utilities are included, providing exceptional convenience.
The building is ideally situated at Sutter and Jones Streets, just five blocks from Union Square, close to Muni, and a fifteen-minute walk to BART. With caf√©s, restaurants, shops, and downtown amenities nearby, this apartment offers comfort, charm, and an unbeatable location.

One Bedroom Apartment in Beautiful Classic Building, listed on the National Register of Historic Buildings, and built in 1916. The building includes beautiful facade, marble entry way with gold leafed angel and gargoyle moldings above, hardwood moldings in lobby, hand carved banister, and birdcage elevator. The Architecture is Renaissance-Baroque Revival. (The exterior of the building has been painted in multiple colors and looks stunning.)
This unfurnished apartment includes new kitchen cabinets, sink with solid granite slab on countertop, new appliances, hardwood floors with mahogany trim, beautiful crown moldings in seven parts, bay windows facing west for afternoon sunlight, separate entry room, large bedroom with walk-in closet, living room has exposed brick and alcove good for office, dining area, or second walk-in closet. New fully permitted laundry room onsite.
Good Location: 821 Leavenworth Street (Sutter/Bush). Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Grace Cathedral, Huntington Park, Union Square, and many good restaurants are all within walking distance.

Originally known as the Langerman's Tobacco and Segar Warehouse built in the 1850's, the Belli Building is more famously known as the Law Offices of Melvin Belli.  It is said that after successfully litigating notorious personal injury cases for celebrities such as Chuck Berry, Muhammad Ali, and the Rolling Stones, Belli would raise a Jolly Roger flag over his office building and fire a cannon, mounted on his office roof, to announce the victory.
Today, this San Francisco Landmark has been fully restored and renovated to offer  modern and comfortable living.  The new "Landmark 9" residences offer spacious living areas, high end appliances, and luxury finishes within a secured building.
This Jackson Square Location offers endless neighborhood options for great dining, watering holes, and coffee shops.  Also known as San Francisco's Interior Design District, Jackson square is surrounded by 25+ furniture and decorative art galleries, advertising agencies, architects and industrial or graphic designers.

This is a two-bedroom unit that was completely remodeled a few years ago. It is a flat style unit located in the front of the building. Top floor. There is no other unit attached to yours on the same level. No one is above you. Unit has remodeled kitchen, bathroom, engineered hardwood flooring as well as appliances that are few years new.
Engineered hardwood over concrete flooring. Concrete provides added insulation against noise from other units in the building. Extremely quiet building. Recessed lightings throughout the entire unit. Recess lightings in the living room, kitchen, hallway and both bedrooms, and inside each bedroom closets. Hardwood floorings throughout the entire unit. Central heat throughout the entire unit. Dedicated gas furnace keeps the unit warm. Decorative fireplace.
Unit has two good size bedrooms. One bedroom has one closet. The other bedroom has 2 closets. All bedroom closets have recessed lights.
The eat-in kitchen is spacious enough to accommodate a small dining table and chairs. Kitchen features a granite countertop, maple cabinets, convection oven with electric cooktop, and a stainless steel refrigerator.
Newer bathroom has a shower/tub bath, all tiles. Bathroom light is a 22-watt LED light, which is equivalent to 3 X 40 watt incandescent lights. According to the manufacturer, it lasts 22 years and is dimmable with a dimmable switch. Skylight is in the bathroom.
The property is located on Clement St. (X-street is 27th Ave.). It is within walking distance to produce stores, diverse restaurants, and a theater. Good hiking trails at Lands End, Golden Gate Park is nearby.
Public transportation is steps away, centrally located near the Geary St. and California St. bus lines.
Owner pays for water and garbage.
Parking is $250.  It is possible that parking may become available.
Income must be at least three times the amount of rent.
Owner may consider 1 cat with good references.

Bright, cheerful 1BR/1BA second-floor apartment in well-maintained, professionally managed 24-unit gated condo building that was built in 1950. No smoking. Pets under 30lbs. okay.
Tile floors in kitchen and bathroom, and carpeted floors in bedrooms in compliance with CC&R provision. Crown moldings. Custom lighting. Gourmet kitchen with slab granite countertop, Cherry Manor cabinets, double stainless steel sink, new Maytag dishwasher, new Miele oven, and Gaggenau halogen cooktop. Three closets with double closet in bedroom. Cable connection. Approx. 575 sq. ft. interior space plus additional space and exclusive use of balcony with southern exposure and planters for private gardening. Bathroom completely remodeled with Italian porcelain tile and Hansgrohe brushed nickel bathroom fixtures.
Located on Clay Street midway between Jones & Taylor. Roof deck with views of SF Bay, Yerba Buena Island, Treasure Island, Coit Tower, TransAmerica Pyramid, Huntington Hotel, and Grace Cathedral. Common laundry room with coin-operated washers and dryers. Elevator in building. Close to Financial District, Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, Polk & Van Ness, and less than 2 blocks from Huntington Park. Also 4-1/2 blocks from Trader Joes.

Beautiful Remodeled View 1-Bedroom with In-Unit Laundry
Property Address
760 North Point St. | 204 | San Francisco, CA 94109
Available: 12/13/2025
Offered By
RDM Apartments
Description
This is a very nice one bedroom unit near the corner of North Point and Hyde streets. It is extremely well appointed and has all the modern conveniences you would want in a nice apartment. The building contains 14 apartments and most of the building has been remodeled to a very high quality level.
The unit is on the third floor on the north side of the building, which means it is away from the street and very quiet. It has a very nice partial view towards the east bay. It has been completely remodeled. It has all new double paned windows with screens and real wood blinds.
The kitchen of the unit includes maple laminate cabinets, granite counters and near new appliances. There is a high quality gas range, built in microwave, dishwasher, disposal, fridge and freezer. Most importantly, it has a brand new in-unit laundry!
The bathroom has a very nice checkerboard design of white and black tile. The plumbing in the building is all rebuilt, including copper pipes, new waste lines, etc. The hot water is instant because there is a re-circulating system with an electric pump which keeps the hot water flowing through insulated pipes. The faucets and shower valves are modern and almost new. There is a large mirror and large medicine cabinet. The bathroom is ventilated by an automatic re-circulating fan system on the roof to help keep the bathroom fresh and mildew free.
The unit has lots of recently upgraded lighting. All of the wiring in the unit is new. There are many electric plugs.
The building as a whole has been very substantially remodeled. We completely restored both the courtyard and the back of the building last year. It looks great. There's also a Swiftlane intercom system for access along with a double gated entry for security.
The unit has a hardwood floor. It is fully insulated (walls, ceiling, floor), so it is warm in the winter and cool in the summer. All of the walls are new sheet rock, with new wood trim throughout as well. The hardware is from Baldwin Brass and is top notch.
Utilities are not included. They run about $250-$300/mo for water, trash, sewer, internet, and PG&E.
Anyway, if you would like to see the unit, give me a call the number listed in the ad or email me. I am the owner and manager ‚Äì you don‚Äôt have to request repairs through a management company. I take care of my tenants. And because the building is largely new, there are few problems anyway. Thanks for your interest.
Sorry, no smokers or pets.

Very secure apartment with independent access from gated stairway in unique Telegraph Hill building on east hillside facing Treasure Island and the Bay Bridge with a deck facing downtown with water views too.  Located on a remote cul de sac with privacy and parking on the street used almost entirely by residents because so isolated.  The building is surrounded mainly by open space with only one home as a neighbor.  The apartment is down two levels from the street.  So much privacy that no window coverings are needed.  All utilities except electricity and free laundry included.  The one bedroom will accommodate a king size bed and has a built in wall of closet. The bathroom has a new shower and basin.  Kitchen is fully equipped and has a view of the Bay.  The combined living-dining room has downtown views, reflected view of the Bay and direct access to the deck, as well as built in cabinets. Fully wired by Comcast.
All hardwood floors except bath and kitchen. Rent controlled and no smoking building. Pets ok at $50/month. Laundry has 2 washers and 2 dryers and requires no payment. The building has NO parking.  Street parking is convenient, however, because street is isolated and used almost entirely by residents of the building; if assured garage parking is desired, there are nearby alternatives for rental in other buildings.

Our Presidio Garden Suite is a pleasant one bedroom apartment located in a great neighborhood with access to both a dynamic commercial area and abundant natural beauty. The Presidio National Park, which is also the gateway to the Golden Gate Bridge is located one block from the apartment.  The local shopping and dining is excellent and within walking distance of the apartment.
The very comfortable one bedroom apartment offers abundant natural light and is itself located on a peaceful garden.  There is an open plan with the living room adjacent to the dining room.  The dining room is next to the kitchen which can be closed off.  The kitchen opens  onto the garden and also offers access to the laundry.  The bedroom has a bathroom en suite and has a window onto the garden.
Public transportation is available one block from the unit and Golden Gate Park is less than one mile away.  Whether visiting family or staying for work, make your next stay a great one at our Presidio Garden Suite.

801 Kirkham Street, San Francisco
2 Bedrooms | 1 Bathroom | Lower Unit | 1 Garage Parking Space Included
Located in the desirable Inner Sunset neighborhood, this charming lower unit in a two-unit building offers the perfect balance of comfort and convenience. The home features fresh new paint, carpeted flooring, and a large living and dining area ideal for relaxing or entertaining. A separate kitchen provides ample counter and cabinet space for easy meal prep and storage.
Centrally situated just two blocks from Golden Gate Park and a five-minute walk to UCSF Parnassus Campus, the unit is surrounded by some of San Francisco's most sought-after destinations. Enjoy close proximity to neighborhood restaurants, shops, banks, and public transportation, including MUNI lines for quick downtown access. Around the corner, you'll also find a famous full-service regular and vegan restaurant featured on "Check Please", along with many other local favorites all within easy walking distance.

2 Bedrooms, 1 Bathroom

FURNISHED monthly rental
Beautiful victorian home in one of the best SF neighborhoods.  Quiet street with excellent access to restaurants/bars, local park, and buses. 2 bedrooms with Queen beds. You can park a SMALL car in the driveway but may need to move it from time to time so that we can access the garage! You'll have a washer and dryer in the house.
Step into this charming single-family home offering 2 cozy bedrooms and 1 well-placed bathroom. As you enter through the front door, you're welcomed into a warm and inviting living room that flows seamlessly into the dining area ‚Äî perfect for everyday meals or casual entertaining.
Just beyond the dining room, you‚Äôll find a functional kitchen, with the bathroom conveniently located just off to the side. The two bedrooms sit next to each other, thoughtfully separated by spacious closets for added privacy and storage.
Laundry is located just off the kitchen, making household chores a breeze. The kitchen has everything you need for a full meal or just a cup of coffee. Large six burner gas stove, full size refrigerator, large double sink, dishwasher, microwave, coffee maker and electric kettle are all available.
This is a free standing home, not an apartment so there is no one above or below you. The owner uses the garage so you might see or hear him outside, but he never enters the property and has a separate entrance to the garage.
Guests are required to sign a lease.
Home available only furnished, minimum stay is 30 nights. Perfect for those needing temporary housing while in SF.
One SMALL parking space is provided in the driveway. A small compact car will fit (think Honda Fit size). If your car sticks too far out into the size walk, City meter maids will ticket you. If this doesn't work, you may be able to park across the driveway if there is room, otherwise you can park on the street. Street parking is limited to 2 hours M-F 8am-6pm and they do issue tickets in the neighborhood.
Please do not block the sidewalk, as you will get a parking ticket.
Here are your options when getting around in San Francisco:
There are public transit options nearby. You can grab a bus at the corner of the block.
Uber/Lyft are incredibly fast, reliable, and cheap. You never have to worry about parking. You don't want to get a parking ticket (prices range from $70-$120).

Shared bath has sliding glass doors and the linen closet is down the hall, next to the two rear bedrooms.
Building is on 3rd Avenue between Irving and Hugo. Large shared yard is paved and has a planted area and borders. Parking space in the building's one-car garage is available for an additional fee. It's a block-and-a-half to both UCSF Parnassus and Golden Gate Park. About the neighborhood:
Cow Hollow is a vibrant neighborhood in San Francisco, known for its mix of residential charm, trendy shops, and proximity to the Marina District and Pacific Heights. Here are some key characteristics of the Cow Hollow neighborhood:
Residential Appeal: Cow Hollow primarily features residential streets with a mix of Victorian and Edwardian homes and newer apartment buildings and condominiums. The neighborhood is known for its picturesque streets and well-maintained properties.
Shopping and Dining: Union Street, which runs through Cow Hollow, is a bustling commercial corridor filled with boutique shops, cafes, restaurants, and bars. It's a popular destination for locals and visitors alike, offering a wide range of dining options and retail therapy opportunities.
Recreational Opportunities: The neighborhood is close to the Marina Green and Crissy Field, which are popular spots for outdoor activities such as jogging, cycling, and picnicking. The Presidio, a large park and former military base, is also nearby, providing additional green space and recreational amenities.
Community Atmosphere: Cow Hollow has a lively and community-oriented atmosphere, with many residents actively participating in local events and organizations. There's a strong sense of neighborhood pride and involvement.
Accessibility: The neighborhood is well-connected by public transportation, with bus routes running along major streets like Union Street and nearby Van Ness Avenue. It's also within walking distance to the waterfront and has easy access to highways for commuters.
Overall, Cow Hollow is known for its attractive residential character, vibrant commercial scene, and proximity to recreational opportunities, making it a desirable place to live in San Francisco.
Melody Simpson

Updated 2 bedrooms plus bonus office in desirable north slope location. Includes large, landscaped backyard with deck, lounge furniture, firepit, hot tub and Weber gas grill. Unit has two levels, each with its own bedroom & bathroom, and front/back yard access.
Upstairs is open and light with 11‚Äô ceilings, new light fixtures and recessed lighting on dimmers throughout. This level has separate dining and living spaces, recently refurbished kitchen with stainless appliances and full-size bathroom with shower/tub combo.
Front porch includes bistro table with sweeping downtown views, perfect for morning coffee or after work cocktail. Kitchen/living area opens to covered back deck with a second bistro table that overlooks the backyard. This level has one bedroom with a large, double-width closet and cedar closet organizer.
Downstairs level has a second bedroom at the rear of house for extra quiet and privacy, an extra room perfect for a dedicated home office, bathroom with shower and updated fixtures. Lower level also includes a separate laundry room with full-size washer and dryer.
Additional details...
-Entire unit has been recently repainted and all floors refinished including original softwood upstairs and matching hardwood downstairs.
-Kitchen has newer high-end stainless kitchen appliances (5-burner LG gas range with large convection oven, dishwasher, microwave and full-size refrigerator), quartz counter-tops, noise-insulated stainless sink with disposal, pull-down faucet, ceramic subway tile backsplash and under-cabinet lighting.
-Upstairs bath recently renovated with new ceramic tile floor and shower enclosure. Both baths have new plumbing fixtures, lighting and vanity mirrors.
-Dedicated forced-air heating with touchscreen thermostat, and full-size water heater.
-Separate laundry room with full-size Samsung washer and dryer.
-Lease includes private high-speed Monkey Brains internet line. Unit equipped with TP-Link wi-fi router with strong signal coverage from front deck to backyard on both levels.
-Convenient, free street parking usually right in front of the house, on safe, well-lighted street. No two-hour limit or resident pass required.
-Very walkable neighborhood within blocks of local markets (Good Life, Whole Foods), 18th Street businesses like Chez Maman, Papito, Uni Sushi, Ruby Wine, etc; and other nearby destinations like Dogpatch, Chase Center and Oracle park. Easy walk to nearby live music at Bottom of the Hill and Parkside.
-Easy access to local transportation, including 22nd street CalTrain station, Muni bus and streetcar lines, and highways 280/101/80. Multiple nearby car, bike, and scooter share locations.
Lease includes Monkey Brains high-speed internet, garbage/recycling/compost and water. Renters responsible for all other items including gas/electric, cable television, other (renters responsible for any internet other than provided MB service). Please note, no satellite TV installation allowed.
Pets are negotiable and may be subject to additional deposit/rent. No smoking, please.
Available 12/1. Rent = $5000/mo with 12-month lease. Deposit = $3000.

This spacious 3BR/2BA flat (approx. 1567 sq ft) is the middle level apartment of a 3-unit building on Wood Street between Geary and Anza. Built in 1989, it offers many high-end finishes as well as beautiful hardwood floors. The gourmet kitchen offers all stainless steel appliances, quartz counters, solid wood cabinetry, and a built-in wine refrigerator. The kitchen's center island transitions to a large living/dining area, which features great morning light and a wood-burning fireplace outlined with African slate.
Each of the bedrooms is Berber carpeted and features large closets. An in-unit Bosch washer and dryer is stacked in one of the bedroom closets. The master suite features a bay window that overlooks views of the rear garden, Lone Mountain, the Pacific Ocean, and the western skyline.

Application Fee: $50 per applicant; Hold/Sec. Deposit: $500; Parking (if applicable): $360/mo ($385/mo EV); Pet Dues (if applicable): $75/mo w/$500 Pet Deposit
**Pet Policy: Mission Bay by Windsor is a pet-friendly community that accepts up to two cats or dogs per home. There is a $500 pet deposit and a $75 monthly pet rent, per pet. Breed restrictions apply. NO Akitas, Alaskan Malamutes, Chows, Doberman Pinschers, German Shepherds, Mastiffs, Pit Bulls, Presa Canarios, Rottweilers, Shar Peis, Siberian Huskies, Staffordshire Terriers, Wolf Hybrids or any variation or mixes of these breeds. All breeds and pets must be approved by property management.
**Garage Parking Info: Parking is $360/mo per vehicle. EV Parking: $385/mo
**SF City Street Parking: The city of San Francisco, unfortunately, does not recognize our address as an approved locale for residential parking permits. This is due, primarily, to the number of vehicles addressed to our community and the fact that we offer parking in the community. In addition, the city is not currently offering street permits to many of the newer multi-family housing developments within proximity to the new Chase Center and Oracle Park.
Complete listings are available on our website, www.missionbaybywindsor.com , under the Floor Plans tab. Only the available floor plans will reflect pricing. Please keep in mind that pricing and availability is subject to change daily. Our apartments are leasing fast. We often have apartments leased sight unseen as our market is very competitive.

Utilities: It is the responsibility of the resident to handle all utilities. Electricity is paid through PG&E.
Water, sewage, trash services and internet are billed together through Minol. Depending on the number of occupants, the total monthly average for all 3 services is typically $230-280/mo-est.
All apartments have an open and spacious floor plan, heat, energy-efficient washer and dryer, and a built in microwave. The kitchen will feature luxurious quartz counter tops, stainless steel appliances as well as updated cabinets and flooring throughout the apartment. In addition, we have underground garage parking spots available to lease.
Mission Bay by Windsor is a non-smoking property with controlled access and key-less fob entries. With a walk score of 82, Mission Bay by Windsor is minutes away from the Caltrain station, San Francisco Muni rail line, AT&T Park, award-winning restaurants and so much more. Our fitness center is open 5AM to Midnight. The fitness center is equipped with cardio machines, strength training equipment and free weights.
Our residents really love it here and we hope you will too!

Owner occupied for the past 14 years.
I have loved living here and have seen this neighborhood grow into a vibrant community. The service., people, and amenities in this building are unmatched. I love waking up and being able to drag myself down to the gym for a quick workout or sauna. I love not having to own a printer because I can go down to the business center. When I'm feeling too lazy to make my own coffee, I love being able to pop over to St. Frank's, Philz, Blue Bottle, or Bluestone... so many amazing places nearby. The Ferry Building is just three (long) blocks away, and it is so lively here during baseball season, which is always fun. Sunrise runs are my favourite because you can see it rise behind the Bay Bridge. Public transit - Muni, BART, Transbay Terminal - are all 1-10 min away. Caltrain is a 20 minute walk.
I will miss this place a lot, but it's time for a change! Would love to find a long term tenant who will love this apartment as much as I have.

The Neighborhood:NOPA
The NOPA neighborhood of San Francisco is a peaceful destination packed with local coffee shops, quaint businesses and pretty Victorian and Edwardian homes. Located in the center of the city its sandwiched between bigger, more well-known neighborhoods like the Haight, Hayes Valley and the Western Addition, giving residents easy access to dozens of popular gathering spots and notable destinations.
1765B McAllister offers, not just a beautiful place to live, but a lifestyle! Living here you are within a plethora of great restaurants, shops, cafes and nightlife! Step out and enjoy:
On your block: Matching Half Cafe (one of our favorites!), Automat-restaurant & Bakeshop, McBaker Market & Deli
Divisadero Street: NOPA,  CHE FICO, 4505 Burgers & BBQ, The Independent, Emporium + + +

~8 minutes to Bi-Rite Market and ~4 minutes to Green Earth Natural Foods

THE APARTMENT:
This spacious unit offers a warm and inviting atmosphere with hardwood flooring throughout the living areas and a sleek, tiled bathroom. Large windows fill the space with abundant natural light and provide excellent ventilation, creating a bright and airy environment. The kitchen is equipped with rich dark-wood cabinetry and crisp white appliances‚Äîincluding a dishwasher‚Äîmaking meal prep and cleanup both stylish and convenient. Perfect for comfortable living in a well-appointed home.
THE NEIGHBORHOOD: THE INNER RICHMOND
The Inner Richmond offers a great compromise of the urban and suburban -- it has both the energy of pedestrians, shops, cafes, and Irish bars as well as quiet nights, a low crime rate, and plenty of good schools. And then there‚Äôs the Presidio to the north and Golden Gate Park to the south. Inner Richmond borders the half of the park with the most things to see and do (other than nature): the Conservatory of Flowers, de Young Museum, the California Academy of Sciences, the Japanese Tea Garden, and the Botanical Gardens. Like any neighborhood in the western part of the city, though, be prepared for wind and fog, but also a relatively lower cost of living.

Updated kitchen includes stainless steel appliances and lots of room for storage. The island offers additional seating and prep space. Gas range, oven, dishwasher, refrigerator, and garbage disposal.

Rear deck leads down to the garage and large lush backyard! Shared with only one other unit. Fully fenced. Recently refreshed and mulched. Lemons, wildflowers, and mature trees create a private oasis perfect for pets, kids, and outdoor entertaining.

Located in the prestigious Pacific Heights Towers across from Lafayette Park, this south-facing residence spans approximately 1,050 sq.ft. and features an expansive living and dining room with floor-to-ceiling windows framing sweeping city views, including Twin Peaks to Financial District. The spacious primary suite includes an ensuite bath and generous closet space, while the second bedroom and full bath provide flexibility for guests or a home office. A fully equipped kitchen is appointed with a Whirlpool refrigerator, Samsung range and microwave, Bosch dishwasher, and garbage disposal. Manufactured wood flooring flows throughout the living spaces, with carpeting in the bedrooms for added comfort.
The Pacific Heights Towers offers 24-hour doorman service, a secure lobby, and a stylish clubroom with bridge-to-bridge views that can be reserved for parties for a fee.
Additional amenities include deeded underground parking, a private storage unit, and convenient shared laundry facilities and convenient public transportation to the financial district. Garbage and water are included in the rent, with radiant heat billed separately to the tenant. The home is Comcast cable-ready, and the owner may consider one small pet under 20 lbs. (no puppies). Building fees include a $500 move-in fee and a $100 transfer fee. Freshly painted, this condo is available now and ready for move-in.

(FULLY FURNISHED NO INQUIRIES FOR UNFURNISHED)
Furnishings blend mid-century modern with custom and vintage pieces, capturing San Francisco's eclectic style.
Gourmet cooks will love the kitchen's stainless steel appliances, marble floors, and granite countertops. The open layout includes a convenient eat-in counter, allowing you to engage with guests seamlessly.
The living/dining area boasts hardwood floors, a vintage bar, and floor-to-ceiling sliding glass doors offering breathtaking city views and easy access to the private terrace.
Speaking of the terrace, it spans the width of the apartment, providing a quiet retreat with a southern exposure, morning sun, and more city views.
Interior Details:
Bedrooms feature dark wood flooring, while bathrooms showcase elegant marble or marble-look glazed porcelain tiles.
The primary suite offers a spacious walk-in closet, a luxurious bathroom with a large tiled walk-in shower, and direct terrace access through sliding glass doors.
The guest bathroom features a marble-top floating vanity and a shower over tub.
Additional Amenities:
Access to the roof deck, perfect for private parties with panoramic views of the City and Bay, from the Golden Gate Bridge to Alcatraz.
ABOUT THE PACIFIC HEIGHTS NEIGHBORHOOD
Conveniently located at the intersection of Pacific Heights, Russian Hill, and the Marina/Cow Hollow, the property offers walkability to Polk, Union, Fillmore, Hyde, Chestnut, North Beach, and Chinatown.
Nearby shopping options include Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, and upcoming BiRite on Polk Street.
Explore diverse dining options, coffee shops, and vibrant streets, all within a short walk.
Enjoy parks like Lafayette Park and Alta Plaza Park, offering stunning views and outdoor activities.
Getting Around:
Easy access to Muni lines #1, 10, 12, 19, 27, 47, and 49, as well as tech bus stops at Van Ness and Jackson.

Description:
Monterey Heights - Updated 4BR/1.5BA Spanish-Mediterranean Home with Garden & Garage
This beautifully updated Spanish-Mediterranean style residence is nestled in the quiet, tree-lined neighborhood of Monterey Heights. Combining classic architectural details with modern upgrades, the home offers a warm and inviting retreat with easy access to West Portal's shops, restaurants, and public transit.
Step inside to soaring ceilings with clerestory windows and a graceful curved staircase. An arched entryway leads to the spacious living room, featuring a marble-surround gas fireplace, built-in shelving, and a large picture window framing eastern city views. The formal dining room provides the perfect setting for gatherings, while the renovated kitchen boasts stainless steel appliances, white Corian countertops, generous cabinetry, and a sunny breakfast nook overlooking the lush landscaped garden.
French doors open from the family room (or 4th bedroom) to a large deck, perfect for BBQs and entertaining. Upstairs, three bedrooms offer peaceful outlooks - two to the garden and one with city views. The master bedroom features a small private deck. The updated full bath includes marble floors, a soaking tub, separate shower, and modern finishes.
Outdoors, the landscaped garden is a true oasis with boxwood topiaries, white roses, a brick outdoor fireplace, water feature with pond, and year-round greenery. A 1-car garage with laundry, storage, and interior access plus driveway parking completes this exceptional home.
Features:
- 4 Bedrooms / 1.5 Bathrooms
- Hardwood floors throughout
- Formal living room with fireplace & built-ins
- Formal dining room
- Updated kitchen with stainless steel appliances & breakfast nook
- Family room/4th bedroom with deck access
- Renovated bathrooms with marble finishes
- Landscaped garden with roses, topiaries, outdoor fireplace & pond
- Garage parking with laundry & extra storage
- Driveway parking available
Location Highlights:
- Nestled in Monterey Heights, known for its peaceful, residential feel
- Just minutes to West Portal Village with boutique shops, cafes, and restaurants
- Easy access to Muni lines for downtown commute
- Close to St. Francis Wood, Miraloma Park, and Glen Canyon Park
- Nearby freeways provide quick access to the Peninsula and Silicon Valley
